flashcards.english: Noun form unchanged in plural. Demonstratives: ino (this), ici (these)
flashcards.notes: Class III includes objects, birds, reptiles, insects, mammals: Metha (table), Baathi (bath), Ng'ombe (cow), Mbica (cup), Terebiceni (TV), Thengie (axe), Nyûngû (pot), Thaburia (candle), Ngûkû (chicken), Ngirathi (glass), Mbirika (kettle), Mbata (duck), Thaani (plate), Kuburi (blanket), Cabi (goat), Ngigî (door). Example: Metha îno îmwe (this one table), Metha ici igîrî (these two tables)

flashcards.english: Îmwe (1), Igîrî (2), Ithathû (3), Inya (4), Ithano (5), Ithathatû (6), Mûgwanja (7), Inyanya (8), Kenda (9), Ikûmi (10), Ikûmi na îmwe (11)
flashcards.notes: Numbers change with noun class. Examples with 'andû' (people): Mûndû ûmwe (one person), Andû erî (two people), Andû atatû (three people), etc. After 10: 'ten and one, ten and two' pattern. Number agreement: îmwe→ûmwe, igîrî→erî, ithathû→atatû
